final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from the juxtaposition of the two panels and the phrase "YES, BUT."

On the left side, we see a person with arms raised in apparent gratitude saying "Thank you..." to movers depicted as wall art, suggesting an airy, effortless, and appreciative completion of a moving task.

On the right side, the comic shows the reality: the movers struggle with fitting a large sofa through a door, eventually pushing it so hard that it ends up crashing out of the building. This stark contrast highlights the often comical gap between expectations and reality, particularly when moving furniture. The humor lies in the cheerful but ultimately unrealistic "thank you" that doesn't match the chaotic reality of the situation.
